  Source   Edit

Interally, the GUI in this engine works with an ECS. Here is where it is defined. Most of the code here is automatically generated, and since they're needed in other modules, they must be exported, and since I can't remove them from the docs, enjoy reading lots of machine-generated code.

Imports

primitives, ../resources, ../utils, ../sprite, ../collider

Types

  hAlign*: HAlign
  vAlign*: VAlign

  Up, Down, Left, Right
  Source   Edit 
DirValues = object
  top*, right*, bottom*, left*: int
Something that is defined for each side (like a padding)   Source   Edit 
GuiElement = object
  case isOwned*: bool
  of true:
    eOwned*: OwnedEntityGuiWorld
  of false:
    eUnowned*: Entity[GuiWorld]
  case kind*: GuiElementKind
  of Leaf:
    nil
  of Container:
    children*: seq[GuiElement]

Main GuiElement object.

It can either contain an owned reference to the ECS entity, meaning that once the GuiElement gets deleted, so will the entity, or an unowned reference. Owned references are similar to unique_ptr from C++, and are very useful if you create lots of GuiElements without bothering to clean them up. Note that to use the owned GuiElements in the GUI you first have to disown them with the disowned proc

The GuiElements form a tree structure that is not contained in the ECS and must be built separately every frame.

  Source   Edit 
GuiElementKind = enum
  Leaf, Container
  Source   Edit
